clinical_study.brief_title: Skeletal Muscle Energy Metabolism in Undernourished Patients With Gastrointestinal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Alterations in Skeletal Muscle Energy Metabolism in Undernourished Patients With Gastrointestinal Cancer

collaborator.agency: Inserm U1069 - Team Nutrition, Growth and Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Undernutrition associated with cancer, or cancer cachexia results from a deterioration of the energy balance that leads to a gradual mobilization of energy reserves in the body and to increasing deterioration of the nutritional status of patients. This will thus significantly reduce quality of life and survival of patients with a lower tolerance to cancer treatments. Despite undeniable progress in knowledge, many pathophysiological mechanisms remain few or not explored, which could explain that there is still no satisfactory therapeutic solution to halt the gradual deterioration of the nutritional status of patients. In this sense, apart from preclinical data obtained in animal models, there is currently no clinical study on the functioning of skeletal muscle energy metabolism in undernourished patients suffering of cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Measurement of muscle mitochondrial bioenergetics by high resolution oxygraphy

secondary_outcome.description: Quantification of muscle lipid droplets by electron microscopy

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of the expression of target genes and proteins
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of the expression of target genes and proteins involved in 1/ mitochondrial metabolism 2/ lipid metabolism 3/ the regulation of energy metabolism and 4/ muscle proteolysis by RTqPCR with SYBR Green and by Western Blot

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of body composition (fat mass / lean mass)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of body composition ( fat mass / lean mass ) by an imaging method scannographic

secondary_outcome.measure: Determining the isotopic composition of nitrogen hair
secondary_outcome.description: Determining the isotopic composition of nitrogen hair spectrometry .

arm_group.description: the intervention, specific to the study, is to take samples on patients with advanced gastrointestinal cancer
the intervention, specific to the study, is to take samples on non-undernourished patients supported for adjuvant chemotherapy as part of colorectal cancer

intervention.description: Blood samples, muscle biopsy and sample of hair

criteria.textblock:
Case group selection criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years ≤ Age ≤ 80 years
- Metastatic colorectal cancer or advanced pancreatic cancer (metastatic or locally advanced)
- Undernutrition related to cancer ( BMI <18.5 ; weight loss > 5% weight in one month or 10% in 6 months)
- Indication to systemic chemotherapy
- Indication to the development of an implantable port
- Life expectancy ≥ 3 months
- WHO General Status ≤ 2
- Patients affiliated to social security scheme
- Informed consent signed by the patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Unbalanced Diabetes
- Systemic corticosteroid treatment
- Any severe uncontrolled medical condition
- Alopecia
Control group selection criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years ≤ Age ≤ 80 years
- Colorectal cancer stage 2 or 3
- Indication adjuvant chemotherapy
- Indication to the development of an implantable port
- Life expectancy ≥ 3 months
- WHO General Status ≤ 2
- Patients affiliated to social security scheme
- Informed consent signed by the patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Undernutrition related cancer ( BMI <18.5 ; weight loss > 5% weight in one month or 10% in 6 months)
- Unbalanced Diabetes
- Systemic corticosteroid treatment
- Any severe uncontrolled medical condition
- Alopecia
